18.5 Autocorrelation Analysis
Statistical correlation summarizes the strength of the relationship between two variables. We
can assume the distribution of each variable ﬁts a Gaussian (bell curve) distribution. If this is
the case, we can use the Pearson’s correlation coeﬃcient to summarize the correlation between
